isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - REMOVE

warning.para: - To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when doing maintenance or service.

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER FROM THE AXLE HOUSING

step1.para: Make sure the vehicle is on a level surface.

warning.para: Support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle only supported by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over and cause serious personal injury.
Properly discard lubricant that is removed from the axle housing. Lubricant that is removed may be contaminated. Contaminated fluid may cause incorrect operation, damage and serious personal injury.

step1.para: Raise the vehicle so that the wheels are off the ground. Support the vehicle with jack stands.
Remove the oil drain plug from the bottom of the axle housing and drain lubricant from the assembly.

note.para: For axles without an oil pump, omit Steps 4, 5 and 6.

step1.para: Remove the oil filter shield from the input bearing cage.
Use a filter strap wrench to remove the oil filter. Properly discard the filter and replace it with a new filter at assembly ( Figure 7).

caution.para: There can be approximately one pint of lubricant remaining in the filter. Be careful that the oil does not spill when removing the filter.

step1.para: If necessary, remove the oil filter adapter.

On an axle with a driver controlled main differential lock, the differential lock must be shifted into and held in the locked (engaged) position. The locked position gives enough clearance between the shift collar and the axle housing to permit the removal of the carrier. Refer to REMOVE DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER FROM THE AXLE HOUSING.

An alternate method to obtain clearance is to remove the cover of the air shift unit from the differential carrier. Remove the piston. Remove the shift shaft and spring from the fork. The fork and the clutch collar will fall into the carrier and the carrier can be removed in the normal manner. Remember to remove the fork and the clutch collar after the carrier is removed.
Remove the stud nuts or bolts and the washers from the flanges of both axle shafts ( Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Remove Stud Nuts or Bolts and Washers From Axle Shaft Flanges

step1.para: If used, loosen the tapered dowels in the flanges of both axle shafts.

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection. Do not hit the round driving lugs on the flanges of axle shafts. Lugs can break and cause serious personal injury.

note.para: A 1.5 inch (38.1 mm) diameter brass hammer can be used for a drift.

step3.para: Hold a 1.5 inch (38.1 mm) diameter brass drift against the center of the axle shaft, INSIDE THE ROUND DRIVING LUGS ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Hold Brass Drift Against Center of Axle Shaft

step3.para: Hit the end of the drift with a large hammer (five to six pounds, 2.26 - 2.72 kg) and the axle shaft and tapered dowels will loosen.

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection when using an air hammer. Power tools and components can loosen and break and cause serious personal injury.

step3.para: Use an air hammer (such as Chicago Pneumatic, CP-4181-PULER or equivalent) with a round hammer bit to loosen the axle shaft.
Put the round hammer bit on the axle shaft between the studs. Operate the air hammer and loosen the axle shaft and tapered dowels ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Loosen Axle Shaft and Tapered Dowels

caution.para: Do not use a chisel or wedge to loosen the axle shafts and dowels. The chisel or wedge can damage the hub, axle shafts and, if used, the oil seals.
Do not use a hammer to loosen or remove the yoke or flange. A hammer can damage the parts and cause alignment problems.

step1.para: If used, remove the tapered dowels. Remove both axle shafts from the axle assembly ( Figure 8).
Disconnect the forward and rear drive shafts.

caution.para: Always use a flange or yoke bar during removal and installation of the flange yoke nut to prevent damage to the gearing.

step1.para: Attach a flange bar to the flange or install a yoke bar over the yoke.
Disconnect the air lines at the inter-axle differential shift unit.
Remove the output shaft nut, washer and yoke or flange. Use a puller tool to remove the yoke or flange from the shaft ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Remove Yoke or Flange From Shaft

step1.para: Remove the output shaft bearing cage bolts and washers. Pull the bearing cage, bearings and shaft assembly from the axle housing. If necessary, loosen the cage from the housing with a soft mallet ( Figure 12).
Put a hydraulic roller jack under the differential carrier to support the assembly ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Put Hydraulic Roller Jack Under Differential Carrier

step1.para: Remove all but the top two carrier-to-housing bolts or stud nuts and washers ( Figure 13).
Loosen, but do not remove, the top two carrier-to-housing fasteners. The fasteners will hold the carrier in the housing.
Loosen the differential carrier in the axle housing. Use a plastic mallet to hit the mounting flange of carrier at several points.
After the carrier is loosened, remove the top fasteners and washers that hold the assembly in the axle housing.
Carefully remove the carrier from the axle housing using the hydraulic roller jack. Use a pry bar that has a round end to help remove the carrier from the housing.

caution.para: When using a pry bar, be careful not to damage the carrier or housing flange. Damage to these surfaces will cause oil leaks.

step1.para: On axles with a driver controlled main differential lock, if air pressure is used to shift the differential to the locked (engaged) position, release the air pressure. Disconnect the air hose from the shift unit.
Lift the differential carrier by the input yoke or flange and put the assembly in a repair stand. Use a lifting tool for this procedure. DO NOT LIFT BY HAND.
